snippet: A spiritual adviser who promised to cure a woman’s father of cancer and said she needed to cleanse evil spirits from her cash agreed to a one-year sentence.
abstract: Janet Miller, fortune teller charged with felony grand larceny after bilking client of $600,000, pleads guilty to lesser grand larceny charge in exchange for promised sentence of one year in city jail; Miller faces similar charges in Houston.
lead_paragraph: A spiritual adviser who promised to cure a woman’s father of cancer and said she needed to cleanse evil spirits from her cash agreed to a one-year sentence.

headline.seo: Woman Pleads Guilty to Larceny in Fortunetelling Case
headline.main: Fortuneteller Pleads Guilty to Grand Larceny Charge
headline.print_headline: Fortuneteller Pleads Guilty to Grand Larceny Charge
